se.jguru.nazgul.core.cache.api

Interface CacheListener<K,V>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - The type of key used within the cache to which this CacheListener should be attached.
    V - The type of value used within the cache to which this CacheListener should be attached.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Clusterable, EventListener, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCacheListener

    public interface CacheListener<K,V>
extends Clusterable, EventListener
    Callback listener for a Cache with KeyType type keys.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAutonomousEvict(K key, V value)
      Callback method invoked when the object with the given key is evicted from the underlying cache implementation.
      void onAutonomousLoad(K key, V value)
      Callback method invoked when the object with the given key is (re-)loaded into the underlying cache implementation.
      void onClear()
      Callback method invoked when the underlying cache is cleared (i.e. its state destroyed and all cached objects evicted).
      void onPut(K key, V value)
      Callback method invoked when the object with the given key is stored within the underlying cache implementation.
      void onRemove(K key, V value)
      Callback method invoked when the object with the given key is actively removed from the underlying cache implementation (by a user call).
      void onUpdate(K key, V newValue, V oldValue)
      Callback method invoked when the object with the given key is updated within the underlying cache implementation.
      void setFilter(String patternFilter)
      Assigns a filter, making this CacheListener only receive events for properties matching the provided patternFilter.

      • Methods inherited from interface se.jguru.nazgul.core.clustering.api.Clusterable

        getClusterId

    • Method Detail

      • onPut

        void onPut(K key,
           V value)
        Callback method invoked when the object with the given key is stored within the underlying cache implementation. Note!. The key and value must not be modified within this callback method.
        Parameters:
        key - The cache key.
        value - The new value (i.e. the value which was created)

      • onUpdate

        void onUpdate(K key,
              V newValue,
              V oldValue)
        Callback method invoked when the object with the given key is updated within the underlying cache implementation. Note!. The key and value must not be modified within this callback method.
        Parameters:
        key - The cache key.
        newValue - The new value - after the update.
        oldValue - The former value - before the update. Note! Depending on the underlying cache implementation, this value may be null if not known and transmitted at the time of invocation.

      • onRemove

        void onRemove(K key,
              V value)
        Callback method invoked when the object with the given key is actively removed from the underlying cache implementation (by a user call). Note!. The key and value must not be modified within this callback method.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the object which got evicted from the cache.
        value - The object that was removed.

      • onClear

        void onClear()
        Callback method invoked when the underlying cache is cleared (i.e. its state destroyed and all cached objects evicted).

      • onAutonomousLoad

        void onAutonomousLoad(K key,
                      V value)
        Callback method invoked when the object with the given key is (re-)loaded into the underlying cache implementation. This is assumed to be the result of an autonomous/internal call within the underlying cache implementation, as opposed to a call to put(key, value). Note!. The key and value must not be modified within this callback method.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the object which got loaded into the cache.
        value - The Object that was loaded.

      • onAutonomousEvict

        void onAutonomousEvict(K key,
                       V value)

        Callback method invoked when the object with the given key is evicted from the underlying cache implementation. This is assumed to be the result of an autonomous/internal call within the underlying cache implementation, as opposed to a call to remove(key) from a server implementation.

        Note! The key and value must not be modified within this callback method.

        Note 2! Depending on the underlying cache implementation, the value may not be known (implying that it is received as null).

        Parameters:
        key - The key of the object which got evicted from the cache.
        value - The object that was evicted, or null if the underlying cache implementation does not know the value at eviction time.

      • setFilter

        void setFilter(String patternFilter)
        Assigns a filter, making this CacheListener only receive events for properties matching the provided patternFilter. If unset, all configuration change events are received by this CacheListener.
        Parameters:
        patternFilter - The java regexp pattern filter.
